abstract: The long-anticipated service, called Places, lets users “check in” and notify friends, and could help the company tap into small-business advertising.
snippet: The long-anticipated service, called Places, lets users “check in” and notify friends, and could help the company tap into small-business advertising.
lead_paragraph: PALO ALTO, Calif.  Facebook introduced a long-anticipated service called Places on Wednesday that could help the company tap local and small-business advertisers and sharpen its competition with Google.

headline.main: Facebook Unveils a Service to Announce Where Users Are
headline.print_headline: Facebook Unveils Service to Announce Users’ Locations

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Jenna Wortham

abstract: Facebook introduced a long-anticipated service called Places on Wednesday that could help the company tap local and small-business advertisers and sharpen its competition with Google.
snippet: Facebook introduced a long-anticipated service called Places on Wednesday that could help the company tap local and small-business advertisers and sharpen its competition with Google.
lead_paragraph: Facebook introduced a long-anticipated service called Places on Wednesday that could help the company tap local and small-business advertisers and sharpen its competition with Google, Miguel Helft and Jenna Wortham report in The New York Times.
